meanings.definition: To fish by trailing a baited line along behind a boat.
meanings.sent1: We went trolling for fish on the lake.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen enjoyed trolling for trout in the river.
meanings.sent3: Dad said we were trolling for a big catch, but all we caught were tiny fish.
meanings.sent4: The boat moved slowly, trolling for the elusive giant marlin.
meanings.sent5: Trolling for fish requires patience and a steady hand.

meanings.definition: To search for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I was trolling the park for my lost keys.
meanings.sent2: The detective was trolling the city for clues.
meanings.sent3: She was trolling the store for the perfect gift.
meanings.sent4: The explorer was trolling the jungle for rare plants.
meanings.sent5: Trolling for the missing puppy, the children searched everywhere.

meanings.definition: To post inflammatory or irrelevant content online with the intent of provoking others.
meanings.sent1: He was trolling social media with rude comments.
meanings.sent2: The internet forum was filled with users trolling each other.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't resist trolling the chat room with silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: The online bully kept trolling the comments section with mean remarks.
meanings.sent5: Trolling online can lead to arguments and hurt feelings.
